result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Stryker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  Attorney to submit letter for jail credit.
Concurrent with: 15CF985.

  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Letter from defendant to the Court requesting a review of the sentence credit listed in the amended judgments of conviction in his cases.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 10/12/2022 - Upon review, it does appear the defendant is entitled to an additional day of credit (so 4 total days in this case, 15CF985). An Amended JOC will be prepared forthwith. No action is needed in 14CF985.**
IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in an opinion filed on June 1,  2022, that: Judgment and order affirmed.
IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Motion for Sentence Credit and for an Amended Judgment of Conviction with attached cover letter filed by defendant.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 08/16/22--The Court will grant the request for 3 days jail credit unless the State objects in writing by August 29, 2022. If an objection is filed the Court will hold a hearing. clerk to advise the parties.**
Acknowledgment of receipt of the Petition for Review filed by the Supreme Court with the defendant; dated June 29, 2022.

IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration is denied. Wis Stat. Rule 809.24(2).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the "motion for removal of confidential and privileged information from" this court's June 1, 2022 decision is denied.

records.addlTxt:
The State of Wisconsin, respondent, seeks permission for its counsel to be allowed access to sealed record item No. 55 so that the State may respond to arguments in the appellants brief. The State also requests permission to cite this item in its brief to the extent necessary to respond to the appellants arguments. Based on the assertions in the States motion, the requested relief is appropriate. References in the brief to sealed material should use initials or other methods to maintain confidentiality. Therefore, 

IT IS ORDERED that the record shall be returned to the circuit court clerk to grant access to the sealed document to the assistant attorney general assigned to this case. The circuit court clerk shall grant such access and return the record back to this court within seven days of the date of this order.

IT IS ORDERED that Stryker's motion to file an amended notice of appeal is granted, and the amended notice of appeal filed in the circuit court on May 17,2021, which references the circuit court's final order dated May 7, 2021 is accepted.
That the RECORD was electroncially filed in the Court of Appeals.

1:30 PM Defendant Robert C Stryker in court, in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert C Stryker appeared by video means.
Case called for motion for post conviction relief filed by Robert Stryker.
The parties had previously filed briefs on the motion and argument was not required by the parties.
The court addresses all points made by the Defendant in his motion.  
For reasons as stated on the record, the court denies the defendant's Motion for post conviction relief.

The court further addresses the defendant's motion to seal the letter from the DA filed on October 18, 2016.  
The court grants the motion and orders that the first 3 pages which include the cover letter and email are not considered confidential and the remaining pages are to be sealed.

  Pursuant to the Supreme Courts Order issued 4/13/2020, this document is deemed filed 12/08/2020 because that is the date it was mailed.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 12/10/2020--Denied without a hearing or further consideration. This document is part of the official court record and the subject of post conviction proceedings. Moreover, there is a strong presumption that court documents remain open to the public and Mr. Stryker has failed to even consider this in his reasoning. Lastly, Mr. Stryker has other avenues of relief, including a properly filed Motion to Redact or Seal.**

03:08 PM Defendant Robert C Stryker in court, in custody, by zoom.   Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom.

Attorney De Peter is no longer attorney of record on this case, but does provide the court with a better understanding of how she came to withdraw as counsel of record on this case.  Attorney De Peter also provides information that Mr. Stryker file the incorrect motion.  Attorney Thurston makes statements to the court as to the status of this case and request this matter be adjourned for further scheduling and briefing. 

The court, for reaons as stated on the record, denies the defendant's post conviction motion filed on July 15, 2020 as it relates to the issue of ineffective assistance of counsel as the argument is deemed premature.

Defendant Robert C Stryker in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Defendant's father makes statements.  Attorney Cotton makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court makes statements/oral ruling. 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1

Imposed Sentence of:

16 Years Imprisonment (Credit - TBD) Concurrent to 15CF985. 

8 Years of Initial Confinement

8 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;

Register as a sex offender.

Prohibited contact with any child under the age of 16.

Prohibited contact with the Miller family. 

Contact with his own children per the family court case.

Computer / internet access to be monitored and controlled by agent.

Photo equitment to be determined by agent.

Sex offender treatment.  

Child Pornography Surcharge:  $500.00 Bail to be applied.  

Cost: $112.00  Bail to be applied
 
DNA surcharge: $ 250.00 Bail to be applied

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

conditions modified
Sentencing hearing on December 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

COURT MODIFIED THE CONDITIONS OF BAIL AS FOLLOWS:  (9/22/2016: Court grants the request to allow the defendant to use a digital camera, at work, only for work purposes, only on the grounds of Wisconsin Precision Casting.  Mr. Stryker is also allowed to use a computer during his 12-step group, Celebrate Recovery, for purposes of helping the group set up the pre-prepared Power Point presentation that is used on a weekly basis.)  Court approves use of computer for purpose of completing 2015 income tax return while supervised by Lawrence Stryker.  Court will allow the defendant to use a computer at work for work related purposes only, during work hours only.  Defendant is not to have any visual recording devices of any type, no cameras. Defendant may have contact with Amy S. for purpose of sale of home, child visition, and divorce proceedings. Not use any digital or video recording devices. No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 and no contact with any victim listed in criminal complaint.  NO access to the internet or use of computers except at a public library or the Department of Work force Development.  Any viewing of pornography of any kind is strictly prohibited.

Cases 15CF985, 14CF1068, and 16CF576 called for a hearing / bail motion hearing.  Defendant Robert C Stryker in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses that it was brought up at the last hearing that a sign language interpreter is needed for this case during trial.  Parties make statements.  Court orders the State to fill out the appropriate documents if they are needed regarding the interpreter.  Attorney Thurston advises they will have an answer by Next Thursday.  Attorney Cotton moves to have the Court retain another interpreter to be able to tell them what the first interpreter is saying to the victim.  Court denies this request.  If the defense wishes to have another interpreter, they need to hire one themselves.  Parties address how a sign language interpreter works in the courtroom.  Court schedules the jury trial in case #15CF985.  Court schedules the jury trial in case #16CF576.   Court takes up bail motion.  COURT MODIFIED THE CONDITIONS OF BAIL AS FOLLOWS:  (9/22/2016: Court grants the request to allow the defendant to use a digital camera, at work, only for work purposes, only on the grounds of Wisconsin Precision Casting.  Mr. Stryker is also allowed to use a computer during his 12-step group, Celebrate Recovery, for purposes of helping the group set up the pre-prepared Power Point presentation that is used on a weekly basis.)

IT IS ORDERED  that this petition for leave to appeal is denied.
